page.title: 16BRAYDON EMPLOYMENT
page.content: The increase of costs over the past years has reduced the number of labourers employed by farmers. There is now an even bigger dependence on families to help with the day to day work. Many look forward to future generations running the family farms. The homes, built for farm labourers and their families, are now let to those who have employment elsewhere, usually at nearby towns, as there are certainly no large or small employers in other types of work here. Reflecting the difficulty some have in obtaining employment in other parts of Britain, one family, now in this area, moved all the way from Yorkshire. The husband found only temporary building and renovation work but this was enough to tempt him, with wife and four young children, to leave relations and familiar surroundings.
